description:
Section 73 application to vary Condition 2 (Drawings and Details) of application Ref P2018/3997/S73 granted for a Section 73 amendment to vary Condition 2 (Drawings and Details) of application Ref. P2017/3074/FUL dated 23 October 2017 (for the erection of full width rear extension at first floor and half width closet wing extension at second and third floor levels and external alterations and balustrades to create second floor rear roof terrace. Rebuilding of existing mansard roof and erection of a roof extension at fourth floor level with installation of glass balustrade to create roof terrace on rooftop. Erection of a single storey extension at first floor level on rear part of site. Installation of new roof lights to the rear and proposed installation of plant to serve commercial unit at mezzanine roof level. Installation of new traditional shopfront and new replacement sash windows to front and rear elevations. Change of use of Tattoo Parlour at basement and ground floor to provide Class B1 office use. Reconfiguration of the existing three residential units (Class C3)).  The amendments are: First floor level - reduction of rear extension width and internal layout changes to the self-contained flat and communal areas; Second floor level - removal of the rear extension allowing for the roof of the first floor extension to become a terrace for the self-contained flat; Third Floor - removal of rear extension and internal layout changes have been proposed to the self-contained flat and the communal areas.  

The amendments are: First floor level - change the commercial mezzanine level to provide additional floor space for flat 1 (C3 residential use); increase the height of the first floor rear extension by 500mm, amend the shape of the first floor rear extension and relocate the approved plant area.
decision_conditions:
3 YEAR CONSENT PERIOD:  The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than 23rd October 2020.

REASON: To comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).
